metadata.title: CVE-2016-9635 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the flx_decode_delta_fli function ingst/flx/gstflxdec.c in the FLIC decoder in GStreamer before 1.10.2 allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(application crash) by providing a 'skip count' that goes beyondinitialized buffer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer0.10-gconf - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.1
gstreamer0.10-plugins-good - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.1
gstreamer0.10-pulseaudio - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good0.10 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.1').
gst-plugins-good1.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1').
